snippet: With deep pockets and years of experience in the often cut-throat world of corporate takeovers, the wealthy businessman Alfred A. Checchi has officially declared himself a candidate to become the next Governor of California.    Mr. Checchi, who an...
lead_paragraph: With deep pockets and years of experience in the often cut-throat world of corporate takeovers, the wealthy businessman Alfred A. Checchi has officially declared himself a candidate to become the next Governor of California. Mr. Checchi, who announced his candidacy on Tuesday in Sacramento, has never run for elective office, but he has a personal fortune estimated at $550 million and he has said he would be willing to spend up to $30 million of his own money to get elected, a pronouncement that left H. Eric Schockman, a professor of political science at the University of Southern California, uneasy about the future of politics, money and the price of democracy in the Golden State.
abstract: Alfred A Checchi, Democratic businessman who has never sought elective office, declares gubernatorial candidacy in California; says he is willing to spend up to $30 million of own money on race; has spent months traveling around state, meeting people and speaking at public functions (M)

headline.main: In California, a Candidate Makes an Early Entry Into the Governor's Race
